thread.title: Madison Central, Lexington Catholic girls reach region soccer title game
thread.title_full: Madison Central, Lexington Catholic girls reach region soccer title game

author: jmoore@herald-leader.com (Josh Moore)
title: Madison Central, Lexington Catholic girls reach region soccer title game
text:
Madison Central, Lexington Catholic girls reach region soccer title game By Josh Moore 
Who: Lexington Catholic vs. Madison Central 
When: 7 p.m. 
Where: Madison Southern High School in Berea 
On Monday, Madison Central won its first regional game in 13 seasons in beating Paul Laurence Dunbar. 
It decided one regional victory wasn't enough and got past Henry Clay in a shootout in Tuesday night's second 11th Region semifinal at Madison Southern. 
Henry Clay, ranked 15th in the latest Maher Rankings, had a goal from Ruby Kate Gray in the 30th minute after the Blue Devils dominated the first half. 
They held a similar advantage for most of the second but surrendered a goal on a penalty kick by Madison Goodman in the 64th minute. The momentum turned slightly in favor of the Indians, who rode that into the overtime period before advancing to their first region championship on PKs. 
"(Henry Clay's) so quick and so talented, to get into overtime was huge for us," Madison Central Coach Chris Dunham said. "And then to win in PKs? You just never know what's going to happen." 
Henry Clay Coach Mebit Aragaw was proud of the effort his girls displayed, especially his seniors'. 
"We had our chances," Aragaw said. "We played great. ... We made one mistake and it cost us." 
Catholic advances 
Alana Hughes was a freshman when Lexington Catholic last reached the 11th Region championship in 2012. 
Her two goals led the Knights to a 2-0 win over Woodford County in the first 11th Region semifinal Tuesday night at Madison Southern. 
Eventual state champion Tates Creek ended LexCath's season in 2012. Hughes played a bit in that defeat. "It's exciting going back," she said. 
While the Knights controlled possession for the bulk of the first half, they had difficulty getting clean shots against a Woodford defense content playing its midfielders deep. 
"We knew they were going to come out really hard, so we had to mentally prepare for that," said Lexington Catholic senior Rachel Yeager. 
Catholic had seven first-half shots, three off set pieces — including a free kick by Hughes that sailed in over Woodford keeper Addie Martin. 
Hitting the free kick "really pushed our momentum forward," Hughes said. She has a frustrating relationship with those sets. 
"Each free kick, I either hit it or miss it by a lot," she said, laughing. 
Kasey Neuer, a junior, said the Knights were motivated by their seniors and coaches to be stronger in the midfield after the break. She said the Knights had a time against Woodford's middle line in their previous meeting, a 2-1 Catholic win. 
The Knights again owned the ball in the second period, managing double-digit shot attempts in the half. That included a lay-in goal by Hughes that followed Martin's stop of a long shot attempt by Austin Wahle. 
Hughes "was hoping for" a hat trick. Her final shot met metal in the 80th minute. She was more than satisfied coming away with the victory. 
Woodford County had won seven of its last eight games. It allowed just 10 goals entering Tuesday, leading the region in that category. 
Catholic meets Madison Central in the finals. Before the second semifinal began, Hughes said her team was ready for either team that it would face. 
"We're ready to keep going, pushing and not stopping," Hughes said. 
LEXINGTON CATHOLIC 2, WOODFORD CO. 0 
11th Region semifinals at Madison Southern 
G— LC: Hughes 2 (FK 37', 59'). 
GK— LC: Williams. WC: Martin. 
Records: Lexington Catholic 20-2-2, Woodford County 15-4-1. 
Madison Central 1, Henry Clay 1 (SO) 
11th Region semifinals at Madison Southern 
G— MC: Goodman (64'). HC: Gray (30'). 
GK— MC: Schneid. HC: Patton. 
Records: Madison Central 14-5-1, Henry Clay 10-8-2. Josh Moore: (859) 231-1307. Blog: Kentucky.com/josh-moore. Twitter: @HLpreps.
